## Public Member Functions

### AdvanceCycle() {#a447ada4d6c779bbef58746e2bb327924}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void ARMBankConflictHazardRecognizer::AdvanceCycle ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
AdvanceCycle - This callback is invoked whenever the next top-down instruction to be scheduled cannot issue in the current cycle, either because of latency or resource conflicts.

This should increment the internal state of the hazard recognizer so that previously &quot;Hazard&quot; instructions will now not be hazards.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-h/#l00059">59</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-h">ARMHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00266">266</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-cpp">ARMHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
EmitInstruction - This callback is invoked when an instruction is emitted, to advance the hazard state.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-h/#l00058">58</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-h">ARMHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00254">254</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-cpp">ARMHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.

### getHazardType() {#abd3b799a5199979babb67c1211b73c7c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ScheduleHazardRecognizer::HazardType ARMBankConflictHazardRecognizer::getHazardType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;, int Stalls)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getHazardType - Return the hazard type of emitting this node.

There are three possible results. Either:
<ul>
<li>NoHazard: it is legal to issue this instruction on this cycle.</li>
<li>Hazard: issuing this instruction would stall the machine. If some other instruction is available, issue it first.</li>
<li>NoopHazard: issuing this instruction would break the program. If some other instruction can be issued, do so, otherwise issue a noop.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-h/#l00056">56</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-h">ARMHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00182">182</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-cpp">ARMHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Reset() {#a25ae1db0989f6576d8a8629ae5a9d4bb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void ARMBankConflictHazardRecognizer::Reset ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Reset - This callback is invoked when a new block of instructions is about to be schedule.

The hazard state should be set to an initialized state.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-h/#l00057">57</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-h">ARMHazardRecognizer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-cpp/#l00252">252</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armhazardrecognizer-cpp">ARMHazardRecognizer.cpp</a>.
